meanings.definition: In a foolish or stupid manner
meanings.sent1: He tripped duncishly over his own shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: She spoke duncishly, not realizing the consequences of her actions.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail duncishly, thinking it was a clever game.
meanings.sent4: The car alarm blared duncishly in the quiet neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The child giggled duncishly as he tried to wear his shoes on the wrong feet.

meanings.definition: Showing lack of intelligence or common sense
meanings.sent1: The duncishly decision led to a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent2: It was a duncishly mistake to leave the keys in the car.
meanings.sent3: The duncishly puppy kept chasing its own tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The duncishly idea of wearing a winter coat in summer made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The duncishly behavior of the squirrel trying to climb the glass window was amusing to watch.
